result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Terry L Gluff

records.addlTxt:
10:11 AM. Defendant Terry L Gluff in court.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Terry L Gluff. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Court reporter appears by zoom. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Court had previously stayed a capias on 09/12/2022. Court quashes capias based on the Defendant's appearance today.  

Defense has discovery and is still awaiting a pre-trial offer from the State. 
The State does not have a pre-trial offer to share. 
Defense requests a status date in 30-45 days to receive offer from the State.
Hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:11 AM Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Terry L Gluff. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Defendant does not appear. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense advises that the Defendant does not appear today due to a car accident. 
Defense is awaiting an offer, has received discovery, and is working to obtain other records. 
State does not have a pre-trial offer at this time. 

State requests a capias. Court will issue and stay a capias.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

9:25 AM Defendant Terry L Gluff in court.  Attorney Tyler A Jochman in court for Terry L Gluff.  Attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Preliminary hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.

10:03 AM Defendant Terry L Gluff in court by zoom video with attorney Tyler A Jochman in person.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Notice of Appearance, filed by Attorney Jochman.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022. (BC)

10:55 AM Defendant Terry L Gluff in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $75.00 per month commencing August 1, 2022.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  If the defendant has an attorney at the next hearing, the Court will allow for him to appear by Zoom.  Hearing scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Hearing on July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

10:48 AM Defendant Terry L Gluff in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse appears as friend of the court.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
